column1: #Text=She is also the only businesswoman awarded that year .
#Text=Annie Ivanova is also the Regional President of Asia Designer Communication Platform .
#Text=Personal life
#Text=Annie Ivanova was born in Tryavna , Bulgaria to an artistic family .
#Text=Her father was an industrial designer and her mother drama teacher .
#Text=Her grandfather had a professional photographic studio in the 1930s .
#Text=During the 1989 revolution
#Text=Ivanova was working as a junior reporter , assisting Reuters photographer Oleg Popov .
#Text=She was a front-line witness of the dramatic events leading to the collapse of communism in Sofia .
#Text=Soon after , with the help of a colleague , she moved to London where she studied design at the London College of Fashion .
#Text=In 1994 Ivanova immigrated to Australia .
#Text=Ivanova identifies herself as an Australian of Bulgarian heritage .
#Text=She has commented that her international work has always been about ' persuading through culture and ideas that reach across borders ' . [ 18 ]
#Text=She has said the Balkan atrocities of the 1990s have left a very deep mark in her mind , becoming a motivational force to pursue a career in international relations .
#Text=Following long term interests in Asian culture , since 2010 she has been living between Melbourne and Taipei .
#Text=The Chinese name given to her by a friend is 易安妮 ( Yì Ānnī ) .
#Text=Yì was taken from the character in I-Ching " Book of Changes " as an auspicious match .
#Text=In Taiwan she is known by her Chinese name . [ 19 ] [ 20 ] [ 21 ]
#Text=Taiwan by Design
#Text=Annie Ivanova is the acclaimed author of " Taiwan by Design : 88 products for better living " [ 22 ] the first comprehensive design book from the Beautiful Island .
#Text=The project took 2.5 years to complete and run a hugely successful crowdfunding campaign raising NT 1,500,000 . [ 23 ]
#Text=The North American release of the book featured on CNN , [ 24 ] and it was reported as breaking news by all major newspapers [ 25 ] in Taiwan .
#Text=Significant Exhibitions
#Text=International Curator-in-Residence
